upgrades.changelog:
* Includes firmware versions: 2.0, 2.10, 2.20, 2.30
* Fixed kWh Reporting Issue: Resolved an edge-case issue where ZEN15 could report inflated kWh values. The root cause was identified as the power metering chip not being properly cleared after an abnormal device restart.
* Updated Factory Reset Behavior: Improved the factory reset procedure to ensure kWh data is fully cleared. After holding the button for 20 seconds, ZEN15 will now restore default settings and reset accumulated kWh values.
* Optimized Power Report Frequency (Parameter 171): Changed the default value of Parameter 171 (Power Report Frequency) from 30 seconds to 300 seconds to reduce unnecessary traffic on the Z-Wave network.
	* Devices using the previous default value (30 seconds) will be automatically updated to 300 seconds.
	* Devices with a custom value configured will remain unchanged.

* Includes firmware versions: 2.0, 2.10, 2.20
* Updated parameter names and short descriptions in the Configuration Command Class to match the Advanced Setting

* Includes firmware versions: 2.0, 2.10
* Added Notification Command Class. The Power Switch will now report (Over-current detected) when parameter 20 (overload protection) is triggered.
* Added parameter 175 - Voltage threshold report.
* Added parameter 176 - Electricity threshold report.
* dded parameter 36 - Turn the power switch on again after the overload protection is triggered.
* Modified parameter 20: The overload protection cannot be turned off anymore, and it can be adjusted between 2 - 5 seconds.
* Fixed a bug when the Power Switch could turn off in edge cases when a large appliance like a dryer was initially starting. The Power Switch will no longer turn off on the initial start up unless overload protection is triggered.
